a kind man. This man loved to fix and restore broken toys for all the kids. Every day, the kids would bring their broken toys to him, and he would make them new again.

He looked down and saw that one of the steps had snapped. He was scared and held on tight.

Lily heard him and stopped. She was scared too. She looked down and saw how high they were.

stopped working. Sara and Tom looked at the broken toy and felt sad.
"Sorry," Tom said. "I was too busy wanting it for myself."
"Me too," Sara said. "I was not nice to you."
They hugged and said they were sorry. Then they went to their mom and told her what happened. Mom was not happy, but she was glad they told the truth. She said they could share another flashlight if they promised to be careful and kind.
Sara and Tom learned that sharing is better than fighting, and that toys are more fun when they glow.

One day, while Tim was playing, he found a broken toy. It was a small, red car. Tim wanted to restore the car, so he asked his aunt for help. Together, they fixed the car and made it look new again. Tim was very happy.
Then, something unexpected happened. When Tim and his aunt finished fixing the car, it started to move all by itself! The car drove around the room, making Tim and his aunt laugh. They had so much fun watching the little red car zoom around the noisy house.

One day, while she was crying, a yellow bird flew into her room. The bird had a special power. It could make her toys new again. The little girl was very surprised and happy. She stopped weeping and started to play with her toys.
But then, something unexpected happened. The bird's power also made the toys come to life! The toys became her new friends and they all played together. The little girl was not lonely anymore and never wept again.

. She comes to the living room. She sees the broken remote and the dark TV. She is not happy.
"What happened here?" Mom asks.

Mom hugs them back. She is not angry. She is glad they are sorry. She says they can watch TV again, but they have to share. They have to take turns. They have to be nice.
Tom and Jen nod. They agree. They say they will share. They say they will be nice.
Mom smiles. She fixes the remote with tape.

play with. One day, the barrel became broken, and Bobo was very sad.
Bobo's friend, Toto the turtle, saw that Bobo was sad. Toto wanted to help fix the broken barrel. Toto had an idea! He would borrow some tape from his friend Dodo the duck to fix the barrel.
Toto went to Dodo's house and asked, "Can I borrow some tape to fix Bobo's broken barrel?" Dodo said, "Yes, of course!" Toto took the tape and went back to Bobo's house. Together, they fixed the broken barrel.

boy named Tim went for a walk. He saw a broken path with many holes in it. Tim wanted to fix the path so no one would fall. He had a big heart and was always careful when he helped others.
Tim went to his dad and said, "Dad, I want to fix the path. Can you help me?" His dad smiled and said, "Of course, Tim. Let's be careful and fix it together." They got their tools and went to the broken path.
They worked together to fix the path. Tim was very careful as he filled the holes with dirt. His dad was proud of him
